pullRequest.title: Expose containers log paths on host
pullRequest.bodyText: This helps to debug CI failures by keeping Hadoop/Presto logs on the host machine

nodes.bodyText: hmm. I recall we already remove it. Please make separate commit anyway.

there can be quite a lot of those. Is there a limit on number of directories bound...
I guess not very low - we used to bind a lot of stuff before moving to copying.

Please rebase onto #4908
title should become paramLabel = <dir> and description should start with uppercase

If i eg invoke test run from intellij directly, where will the logs go to?
the logs/ folder does not exist, right?
maybe it should be null by default, or tempdir?
(same for env up)

I'd rather see caller do the cleanup (if needed)
This configuration method should ideally be just that -- a configuration method without side effects

withExposedLogPaths and exposeLogsInHostPath look like configuration methods, but currently need to be called in correct order
let's add some verify to ensure they are always callled in that order.
simplest way would be

to null out logPaths inside exposeLogsInHostPath
to check logPaths != null yet in withExposedLogPaths

(i don't see a need to support the methods being called in varying order, so let's not spend time on that)
nit: rename to exposeLogsInHostPath for consistency.

What drive what is default value of option here. The value assigned to bindPorts variable?
If so can you just declare option ss @Option(names = "--bind", description = "Bind ports on localhost", negatable = true)
I am not convinced we need those. And even if we do,  I would put them before failed ones. So it is easy to scroll down to failed list of failed tests on GHA.

this is not useful.
Can we make it a single digit number. Only present if there actually is a conflict.
Or alternatively you can just put an index of SuiteTestRun in the list in the string. Right?

commit.message: Expose containers log paths on host
Remove collision when running same environment multiple times in suite

afterCommit.message: Remove collision when running same environment multiple times in suite
